column4: how to install Kernel Headers? I use Ubuntu 7.04 updated, and kernel is 2.6.20-16-generic
where to find kernel headers for 2.6.20-16-generic
modprobe (and most unix programs) will say nothing if it succeeds
no it shouldn't if the module is loaded nothing isd printed on console (it may log something to /var/log/messages )
I have checked, but in /var/log/messages it's not writen what I should be albe to read on terminal (if I'm not connected over ssh)
quote "If the driver load was succesful, no output is received at the console. We can check this by looking at the kernel ring buffer .... "
the ring buffer is dmesg or /var/log/messages
TIME is not needed. sudo shutdown -r 23:00
